results.title: The Harvey girls
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: It is the end of the nineteenth century and the future lies in the wild west. Judy Garland is a young woman attracted to the work opportunities along the great Sante Fe railway. Of all opportunities available there is none more alluring than Frank Harvey’s chain of hotels and restaurants. Making her way out west she joins Anglea Lansbury, Marjorie Main, Cyd Charisse and a great Hollywood cast to become one of the “Harvey Girls”. This opulent and sunny film is a great example of the Hollywood musical genre and features an outstanding musical score by Johnny Mercer and Harry Warren (songs include “Oh, You Kid”, “On the Atchison”, “Topeka and the Santa Fe”). Cast also includes John Hodiak, Ray Bolger, Preston S. Foster.

results.title: The Greta Swamp
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: The area surrounding Greta, in north-eastern Victoria, used to be a swamp, home to indigenous wildlife and the mythical Bunyip creature. The swamp was drained as part of a government employment project in the 1890s, leaving behind rich fertile land ideal for grazing, however it also created a complete change in the area around Greta, especially in the hill country, causing environmental damage. One hundred years on and local Land Care members Anthony and David Griffiths, along with 2012 Land Care President Phil Gottschling, have dedicated their time and energy to try and reverse the effects of the dredging and are revegetating their land to restore balance to the environment.

results.title: Beak out
results.brief_description: A quietly humurous 3D computer animation set in the quiet after hours of a flightless bird museum. The stationary bird exhibits slowly come to life. One skeleton in waking, a pre-historic flightless bird, dreams of flying and is by ironic twist of fate, flung across the room to land on an aeroplane model. His flight, ironically, is short lived when both the flightless bird and the airplane crash together to the ground.

results.title: Greta Craft Group
results.creator_credit: Matt Blackwood, Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: Women come from great distances bringing their knitting needles, sewing machines and a good yarn to the weekly Greta Craft Group. The group was started by Kath White in the early 1990s when, as a young mum and new to the area, she reached out to other mums for some companionship. The group grew from there and became so popular they needed a waiting list for those interested to join - as Winifred Suffield suggests “craft is just an excuse to meet”. 2012 President Helen Bird and long time members Nola Jones and Julie White, speak about the support and friendship that the group has provided over decades. We hear the sounds of laughter and chatter as the ladies make all sorts of beautiful crafts which they provide to charities, both locally and internationally.

results.title: During that time
results.brief_description: This humourous 2D hand-drawn animation is also a hard-luck story of a man locked in a fortified jail in the middle of the ocean. He receives instructions on how to escape and sets about to dig himself out. Bearing a strong resemblance to the animated character, Mr. Garrison from Southpark, the prisoner crawls through his tunnel to find he’s landed on a deserted and barren island and is no better off, a possible play on the plot-line of Pappillon.

results.title: The Greta Bunyip Newsletter
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: In the digital age it’s all well and good for those who are connected via high speed internet, but in some rural towns it is the good old fashioned newsletter that keeps locals in the know. The Bunyip Newsletter is hand-delivered across the wider Greta area by six committed volunteers. We meet Noeleen Lloyd and Allan Porker as well as local historian Joan Ellis and hear about the importance of having a local newsletter. ‘The Bunyip’ was born out of a demand from the locals to be better informed and more connected to their community and surrounds. Over 300 newsletters are distributed every two months containing articles of historical, sporting and community importance.

results.title: Leningrad
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Tom Roberts, Angus MacQueen, BBC and October Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Hand of Stalin”.
In the 1930s Stalin consolidated his power by creating a strict heirarchical level of command which depended upon paranoia and authoritarian repression for success. Millions of people were accused of “crimes against the state” and forced to sign confessions in show trials which only added to the growing societal hysteria. In interviews with both survivors and administrators of the “purges”, we see how the use of informers and the secret police led to a social order of mistrust where neigbour turned on neighbour and sibling on sibling. Filmed in the old city of Leningrad this powerful documentary shows how the purges, with their subsequant tortures, imprisonments and violence are still the cause of deep anguish for contemporary Russians.

group_siblings.title: Leningradskaya: a village in southern Russia
group_siblings.creator_credit: John Walker, Tom Roberts, BBC and October Films
